website_summaries.verdict: The Saucony Zealot ISO 3 is a neutral, road running shoe that’s in the higher price range. This newest edition in the Zealot series possesses the fan-favorite features that were present from the previous iterations. On top of that, components were tweaked to enhance the shoe’s cushioning, ride and responsiveness. This makes the shoe well-balanced and lightweight, ready to take on any activity or running session.
pros: Most users observed that the Saucony Zealot ISO 3 was able to offer great cushioning
One tester narrated that the shoe felt great all throughout his walk and run
Several runners observed that the bounce of the midsole has been retained
Another runner expressed that it’s well-balanced in its construction
A few testers said that the shoe performed well on both road and trail
Some runners said that the toe box had an agreeable space for toe-splay
A user felt that this iteration offered a more relaxed upper compared to the uppers of the previous versions
One runner expressed that this was one of the shoes that delivered a well-cushioned experience
cons: One user narrated that the cushioning under the ball of her foot was not enough
A few runners said that the arches felt loose
One tester commented on the white midsole not matching the dark upper
A small group of users was not satisfied with the number of color options the shoe came in
One user mentioned that he was stuck in between sizes which left him at an inconvenience
Going up a size, he felt that this shoe was a tad bigger
Choosing a size down, he expressed that the shoe was a bit tight
One runner felt pain on the ball of his foot every time he ran with the shoe

customer_reviews.title: Cushioned but lightweight and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I run in mostly neutral and minimal shoes with a minimal heal-to-toe offset. But when training for a marathon, I like to have an extra pair of shoes for long runs to prevent the injuries that come with high mileage. These shoes give me the extra cushioning I need for high mileage while still having a fairly minimal heal-to-toe and being feeling to heavy or clunky. They felt comfortable right out of the box and I haven’t had any issues with hotspots. At the time I bought these on Amazon I was able to find them for only $85. A great deal at that price.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Richardson

customer_reviews.title: They run small, buy half size larger.
customer_reviews.text: this seems like a really nice shoe, but they are unfortunately a tad small for the size and hurt my feet a little. it is a shame because i already used them so i can't return but they run small so you should buy one half size larger than you usually require.
customer_reviews.author: Brendini

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic shoes. I replaced a pair of Zealots with ...
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic shoes. I replaced a pair of Zealots with these Zealot Iso 3s and it's a nice upgrade. I regularly run multi-mile treks and my feet feel great in these. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kal-El

customer_reviews.title: This may be better on long runs to prevent blisters
customer_reviews.text: Switched from the Zeolot ISO2 to test for replacing for my race shoe. It feels a little lighter, but the main difference is that it is not as snug and the toe box feels wider. This may be better on long runs to prevent blisters. I have only done an 18 miler so far this week, but that went good. I will probably order 3 or 4 more to cycle into my rotation for long running.
customer_reviews.author: Edgreen

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable out of the box but they wore out quickly
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these shoes right out of the box. They are very comfortable and I almost bought another pair after a couple weeks. Good thing I didn't. They wore out on the bottom in about half the miles of my last pair of UA shoes. I only got about 250 miles out of these before they were worn out around the balls of my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but...
customer_reviews.text: It's a light shoe with a lot of cushioning. The under foot feeling is on the plush side but not too mushy. The breathability of the shoe is very good. Despite all these my second try with Saucony didn't work again. After running in freedom iso 20k I put them aside and wanted to give a second chance with zealot iso 3. Their slim and long design makes me somehow supinate. I miss Hoka and Altra's spread design. Maybe I also so got used to metarocker design these kind of shoes feel too flat for me. It's a great shoe but didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mumin Gunes

customer_reviews.title: My new go-to shoe for long runs
customer_reviews.text: I keep these shoes in rotation with my Saucony Ride 12 shoes and I tend to favor them for my longer runs. Very cushy, very comfy - no hot spots or issues so far. I do add New Balance 3810 insoles to pretty much all my running shoes, so I can't comment much on the factory standard insoles.
customer_reviews.author: John Brown

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I thought they would be, be still a very good shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I have another pair of these in 11 1/2 and I thought they were running a little large. They felt almost a little too roomy, so I bought this pair in a 11. The difference is more than I thought it would bee. The toe box feels tight and the length feels short, almost like I went down a full size instead of a half size. I prefer the half size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg J

customer_reviews.title: Poor mid-forefoot durability for this heavy runner, but still tough to beat.
customer_reviews.text: These fit a little narrower in the forefoot than previous versions. They wear alarmingly fast under my heavy mid forefoot landing body, but that's the story for all of the lightweight low minimalist runners I've tried. For the most part the zealot 3s are the same great balance of weight and cusion.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Finally, another Zealot worthy of the name
customer_reviews.text: I loved the original Zealot iso. I stock piled a few pairs as they went out of stock. So glad that this 3rd generation has a lot of what was right with the 1st gen and has corrected everything that for me was wrong with the 2nd gen. This latest version is a touch heavier (about 0.5 oz) than the first gen and has a bit more heal padding (like the triumph iso). Still perfect for a supinator like me. Light enough for race day. Comfortable enough for the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love the shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love the shoes. Looks good. Only thing I didn't is the fact as much as I run and did not know the sole was more of a foam and less supportive. I need stability and they were not it. I just ordered another pair of shoes with more supportive sole.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: I only run with Saucony's
customer_reviews.text: Love my Saucony running shoes. Comfortable and fits great. As with all running shoes, make sure to buy half to one size bigger than regular shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl T

customer_reviews.title: Light & Comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are lightweight, comfortable to wear, and great for short distance running or jogging. They are well made, durable for light use, and easy to wear. Would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much better than traditional lace-up running shoes
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! This is my first time trying the "sock-like" running shoes. I jog 24 miles per week and I'm not having to tape-up my toes like i used to even with new shoes. NO BLISTERS. Plus they look really stylish. Walking on the "gel" really changes what you're used to with a running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hardesty

customer_reviews.title: Great all-around shoe, 5k to marathon.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best shoes I have run in. My favorite is the New Balance Beacon but this is right up there. Great cushioning with lite weight and decent energy return. A bit heavier than the Beacon but the out sole is so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Very much like the original Zealot
customer_reviews.text: Thus far I've run in the Zealot, Zealot 2 and Zealot 3. I was a little disappointed when they updated the Zealot to the 2 and made it heavier and changed the fit / feel a bit. This is closer to the original than the 2.
customer_reviews.author: James R Lowe III

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes I’ve had.
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable running shoes I’ve ever had. The tops are a little thin for cold weather and rain, but worth it for comfort and keeping feet cool in hot weather. My toes don’t get jammed in front of shoe like my other more expensive shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Midsantiam

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I had 2 pairs of the ISO 2’s which were great running shoes. It seems the quality has dropped on these shoes. Not near as much support and my feet actually hurt when I completed a 4 mile run (which is abnormal and never happened with the ISO 2)
customer_reviews.author: FN2187

customer_reviews.title: Aggresive arch support
customer_reviews.text: I have mid/low arches. The arch support for these is very aggressive, so it made the shoes uncomfortable for me. Runs 1/2 size smaller (all Sauconies seem to be this way).
customer_reviews.author: Zoolook

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love these, but didn't
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as Hurricane Model. Too Tight, not as well built. Guess I have to spend the cash and get the hurricanes ISO....
customer_reviews.author: AhoyHoy

customer_reviews.title: 5 star
customer_reviews.text: Opened the box and put them on and walked 4 miles with NO break-in.....very comfortable shoe' Saucony got it right on this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Great flexibility, but beware of slipping!
customer_reviews.text: Despite the shoe fitting well on my foot, I do find that the Zealot Iso 3 tends to slip off your foot at a higher rate than previous versions of the shoe. Not a huge deal as long as you lock your laces, but if you are used to running with the laces in a more loose setting, this shoe might not be for you.
customer_reviews.author: Philipray88

customer_reviews.title: Go to shoe
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought numerous pairs. He’s an avid runner that does marathons on down. He likes the cushion it gives on longer runs. Less foot, leg fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: Krippy

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, very happy with its performance
customer_reviews.text: Great price, great fit, and has been performing well. The shoe has a great upper and the traction is fantastic. Also, it is somewhat light, so it is great for distance training.
customer_reviews.author: IT professional

customer_reviews.title: Left foot never seemed to fit correctly
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these same shoes previously and have had no issues. The last pair had a defect in the left show. It was much tighter and the material seemed worn.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Buy in dark color, better... And width!
customer_reviews.text: Nice but squeaky! Wish they had those in width! I'd definitely buy that. But it gets dirty easily so no thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Hurley

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I go to the gym a couple times a week, I run on the treadmill and needed a good support running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: m germ

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort and stability
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, comfort and stability. Light weight and arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great Sneaker
customer_reviews.text: Saucony Men's Zealot Iso 3 Running Shoe is lightweight, comfortable and designed well. I would purchase this sneaker again!
customer_reviews.author: rebecca Mandia

customer_reviews.title: Good Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Shoe are comfortable, but the left shoe seem to be irregular in size. It is slightly smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Hubby80

customer_reviews.title: Great Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are true to size and they are very light weight. I run six miles per day in them and they are holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff Lane

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very light! Its like tou are wearing nothing on your feet!
customer_reviews.author: Jovito C.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed these shoes. I run 3-4 days a week and have put nearly 100 miles on them so far and I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: toddlermama2014

customer_reviews.title: Zealot is the premiere shoe in the lineup of saucony shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Heavy footbed supporteivals hurricane iso 3. Ordered 1/2 size larger. Love the shoe so far.
customer_reviews.author: Star Child

customer_reviews.title: Go up a half size.
customer_reviews.text: NICE COMFORTABLE SHOE. I HAVE PUT JUST OVER A HUNDRED MILES ON THEM AND SO FAR THEY HAVE HELD UP VERY WELL.
customer_reviews.author: KEN BEAULIEU

customer_reviews.title: Repeat Buyer
customer_reviews.text: I have had four pairs of this model and eight total pairs of the Zealot Iso line. I previously ran in the Saucony Kinvara but these have a similar feel with more cushioning. Only negative is that the sole wears out a little too fast for the mileage compared to previous models.
customer_reviews.author: CAP

customer_reviews.title: Great Cushion
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent running shoe if you need a low drop, cushioned, neutral shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not look like the picture
customer_reviews.text: These shoes looked nothing like the picture they were big or in bulkier and seeing the to be maybe an irregular. I sent them back
customer_reviews.author: Irma M. Rucker

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit if you order 1/2 size larger. Great running shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Harold Myers

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and stable
customer_reviews.text: A perfect everyday running shoe for any distance and recovery runs. A bit soft for speed work and not as snappy as the Kinvara. It's a really nice ride overall.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing light
customer_reviews.text: This is good for training but as other reviews have said excellent for race day. Light and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Popka

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Zealots- great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Saucony runners and they don’t disappoint. Fit as expected with great support while running.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Foster

customer_reviews.title: love saucony
customer_reviews.text: tried all the other brands - asics, nike, adidas, brooks, NB. saucony isbthe best for my legs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Once ahoes
customer_reviews.text: A 2 to 4 mile runner 3 to 5 times a week. Very comfortable and seem to be good at cushioning the eun.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry-KC

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: I liked the color choice and that my size was in stock at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Scot Humes

customer_reviews.title: The shoe is little bit higher than Zealot iso 2 and 1
customer_reviews.text: I love this shoe, it's my 3rd Zealot 🤩 I didn't liked its colors on the screen but in reality its beautiful and fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: gad hakimi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome long distance running shoe.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. Love the fit and comfort on short and long runs.
customer_reviews.author: Marathon Jon J

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ive only worn these shoes 8-10 times and the logos are coming detached.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Lots of cushioning
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, lots of cushioning in the balls of feet.
customer_reviews.author: Lorie A Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Favorite running shoes
customer_reviews.text: My son is an avid runner and these are his favorite running shoes. We have been buying them at a running store and were thrilled when we found them cheaper on Amazon. He loves the light weight of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for great price.
customer_reviews.text: These are great running shoes. My son loves the arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

product_meta.title: Saucony Zealot ISO 3 Running Shoes
product_meta.description: Saucony Zealot ISO 3 Running Shoes The Saucony Zealot ISO 3 delivers maximum cushioning at a minimal weight with dynamic, foot-hugging ISOFIT in a low-profile package to help push you further than ever before. ISOfit Upper As part of the ISO-Series, the Zealot features an ISOFIT upper. Designed with an ultra-soft inner crafted from malleable air mesh, the upper guarantees that air permeates the exterior, allowing ventilated air to cool the feet when temperatures rise. Add to that a floating support cage and the Zealot adapts to the contours of the wearer's feet, increasing the responsiveness of the shoe. Capitalising on the consumers' needs, a revolution in fit has been engineered with supreme breathability and pliability. FlexFilm technology is also incorporated into the upper to provide an exoskeletal support frame for unparalleled strength and comfort. FlexFilm is heat melded to the upper, which reduces the amount of stitching and creates a soft, almost seamless surface against the runner's foot. When the laces are tied, the FlexiFilm overlays tighten to secure your foot in place and minimise any unwanted movement for an unbelievably stable run. Everun/PWRGRID+ Midsole Everun cushioning is three times more durable than Saucony's standard cushioning, and it delivers a greater energy return to put a spring in your step whilst you run. The cushioning is placed closer to your foot for increased responsiveness, and therefore provides a smoother transition through the gait cycle than this shoe's ancestors. The Zealot ISO 3 also features a PWRGRID+ midsole, which offers 20% more cushioning than its predecessors. The optimised materials and geometry employed by Saucony work with the runner's stride to promote a more efficient run. The blend of the ISOFIT upper and PWRGRID+ midsole along with the 4mm offset allow the Zealot to perform immaculately over a wide range of distances. The Everun topsole and PWRGRID+ midsole work in unison to provide a stunning ride
feature_bullets: 3mm EVERUN Topsole construction provides and energized ride
Engineered mesh upper for a more dynamic, adaptable fit
Updated TRI-FLEX outsole for the optimal blend of flexibility and protection
